current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To provide that service of the members of the organization known as the United States Cadet Nurse
			 Corps during World War II constituted active military service for purposes
			 of laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
United States Cadet Nurse Corps Equity
			 Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: United States Cadet Nurse Corps Equity Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Service deemed to
			 be active military service

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is
			 deemed to have determined that qualified service of a person constituted
			 active
			 military service.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 401(a)(1)(A) of the GI Bill
			 Improvement Act of 1977

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall issue an honorable discharge under

to each person whose
			 qualified service warrants an honorable discharge. Such discharge shall be
			 issued before the end of the one-year period beginning on the date of the
			 enactment of this Act.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section
			 401(a)(1)(B) of the GI Bill Improvement Act of 1977

text.#text:
No
			 benefits may be paid to any person as a result of the enactment of this
			 Act for
			 any period before the date of the enactment of this Act.

term.#tail:
means service of a person as a member of the
			 organization known as the United States Cadet Nurse Corps during the
			 period
			 beginning on July 1, 1943, and ending on December 15, 1945.

text.#text: For purposes of this Act, the term
